credential.title: Credentials
credential.description:
CREDENTIALS

The Credentials module is used to detect compromised credentials from your company.The credentials that are recovered can relate to external client customers, 3rd party affiliates and to internal IT and business applications.

There are two types of compromised credentials:

Botnet Credentials

Credentials that have been stolen by Crime servers. Threat Compass is able to detect this kind of credentials due to botnet control panels misconfigurations.

Hacktivism credentials

Credentials that have been leaked at cybercrime and hacktivist sources such as forums, paste sites, P2P, dark web sites, etc.

Stolen and leaked credentials may be used for fraud, underground sale, blackmail, crimeware, reputational damage, hacktivism, identity theft, and espionage.

social_media.title: Social Media
social_media.description:
SOCIAL MEDIA

The Social Media module checks for brand abuse in different Web 2.0 repositories, such as blogs, forums, websites, and social networks. With this module, an organization can also collect information on user sentiment regarding a brand, organization or a product. It is also possible to monitor mentions to VIPs of your company to be aware of any negative comments against them.

credit_card.title: Credit Cards
credit_card.description:
CREDIT CARDS

The Credit Cards module recovers stolen credit card information in real-time in order to:

Protect employees and end clients from fraud.

Be able to detect immediately if your credit card has been compromised and ask your bank to cancel your card before it is used by the thieves.

Stolen and leaked credentials may be used for fraud, underground sale, blackmail, crimeware, reputational damage, hacktivism, identity theft, and espionage.

domain_protection.title: Domain protection
domain_protection.description:
DOMAIN PROTECTION

The Domain Protection module looks for typo-squatting and prevents attacks such as phishing or Intellectual Property infringements related to your company. You can use this module to detect two types of threats:

Phishing:

Phishing attacks are used to obtain sensitive information such as usernames, passwords, and credit card details by hosting a fake interface on a third-party domain.

Typo-squatting:

Similar domains to the ones owned by the organization being monitored. Typo-squatting is registering, trafficking in, or using a domain name with the intent to profit from the goodwill of a trademark belonging to someone else.

mobile_apps.title: Mobile App
mobile_apps.description:
MOBILE APP

The Mobile Apps module is used to detect fake apps impersonating your organization or using your corporate identity without authorization (e.g. name, logo, images) in app markets and also, official apps related to the monitored organization located in alternative app markets without authorization. These apps may be outdated versions or may have been modified to include malicious behavior such as phishing.

Any app uploaded without organization could have modified with malware or could have been uploaded with the purpose of stealing sensitive information from its users.

malware.title: Malware
malware.description:
MALWARE

The Malware module allows you to detect malware seeking to steal sensitive information or commit fraud. It collects malware samples from public repositories, mailboxes, honeypots, honey clients, etc. that might be targeting one or more of the companies that make up your global organization. After an automated analysis, the module will provide information about malware behavior, C&C panels, and actions performed by each malware sample.

Through robust and continuous analysis of millions of malware samples per month, Threat Compass provides forensic reporting on malware behavior targeting your systems.

data_leakage.title: Data Leakage
data_leakage.description:
DATA LEAKAGE

The data leakage mention locates mentions to your company name, products and brands in documents published in public or cloud repositories.

The aim of this module is to detect documents containing sensitive or confidential information that should not be publicly available. Noticing that these documents have been leaked online the company can propel actions remediate it such us submitting a takedown request in the short-term and enforcing the privacy and confidentiality policy of the company in the long-term.

hacktivism.title: Hacktivism
hacktivism.description:
HACKTIVISM

The Hacktivism module monitors hacktivism activity on social networks, paste sites, IRC chats, etc. in order to be aware if there are hacktivism groups seeking to attack technological assets of your organization. This module also allows you to identify and detect vulnerabilities and 0-day/1-day attacks affecting the software and hardware used by your company.

Knowing when criminals plan on disrupting your business is critical information when it comes to protecting your employees, assets and brand reputation.

media_tracker.title: Media Tracker
media_tracker.description:
MEDIA TRACKER

The Blueliv Media Tracker module retrieves news from newspapers worldwide, based on their RSSs. The languages of the monitored newspapers are English, German, French, Italian, Spanish and Portuguese.

Also, the module checks blogs and magazines related to cybersecurity, vulnerabilities, and hacktivism.

dark_web.title: Dark Web
dark_web.description:
DARK WEB

The Dark web module looks for information related to your company published in the Dark web.

Dark web sites can only be visited through a TOR (or similar) browser, even though, Threat Compass crawler will take a screenshot of the webpage, including also a markdown copy of the content and a highlight of the place at the webpage where the monitored parameters where found.

Criminal groups organize themselves on the Dark Web, planning and exchanging tools and information before, during and after an attack. You can use this module to become better informed about criminals targeting your organization and proactively prepare countermeasures.

Additionally, you can use the ‘Search’ tab to conduct punctual searches in real-time.

threat_context.title: Threat Context
threat_context.description:
THREAT CONTEXT

The Threat Context module provides SOC, Incident Response and Threat Intelligence teams with continuously updated and intuitive information around threat actors, campaigns, malware indicators, attack patterns, tools, signatures and CVEs. Analysts can rapidly gather enriched, contextualized information to enhance cybersecurity processes before, during and after an attack.

Furthermore, this module facilitates the analysis of actors and campaigns affecting your organization or sector, using information that can also help red teams execute highly realistic attack simulations.

custom.title: Custom module
custom.description: CUSTOM

explorer.title: Explorer module
explorer.description:
EXPLORER

The Explorer module is a targeted module, based on the global Threat Context information, that helps to determine the level of exposure the organization is facing.

The aim of this module is to detect vulnerabilities by configuring the specific technologies a customer is interested in, upload files to be analyzed with our Threat Intel Driven Sandbox or be informed about malware samples targeting the organization. All of this, adding basic contextual information that will help to make decisions to prevent this kind of threats.
